Quarti et al. proved that the electronic properties of the 2D perovskites were influenced by the length of the organic alkyl chain, and a longer chain led to an increase in the bandgap. 98 Theoretical calculation of (C 6H 13NH 3) 2PbI 4 and (C 12H 25NH 3) 2PbI 4 indicates that this effect is caused by the distortion of the PbI 6 octahedral structure due to the long alkyl chains. So, the size of organic cations plays an important role in adjusting the inorganic layer structure, thus leading to the regulation of the bandgap.[qv: 4b,27b,99] According to a recent report, 26 the length of the alkyl chain between the aromatic ring and the ammonium group, rather than the number of aromatic rings, is vital in the bandgap of 2D perovskites containing aromatic cations (Figure 5c). In addition to the chain length and dielectric constant of cations discussed earlier, perovskite phase transition can also affect the structure and optical properties.
